hindrances.summary_minor: The hero has a dark secret of some kind.

hindrances.summary_minor: As Minor, Pace reduced by 1 and running die is a d4.

hindrances.summary_minor: The character is particularly susceptible to personal attacks. As a Minor Hindrance, he subtracts two when resisting Taunt attacks.

hindrances.summary_minor: The character is physically unattractive and subtracts 1 from Persuasion rolls

hindrances.summary_minor: The individual has pledged himself to some cause

hindrances.summary_minor: Minor has 4 attribute points and 10 skill points, extra Benny per session.

weapons.name: Lance
weapons.notes: when charging, only usable in mounted combat

weapons.name: Bangstick
weapons.notes: A shotgun shell on a stick used in melee; must be reloaded with a fresh shell (one action)

weapons.name: Bayonet
weapons.notes: Str +d6 and Parry +1 attached to rifle, Reach 1, two hands

weapons.name: Billy Club/Baton
weapons.notes: Carried by many law enforcement officials

weapons.name: Brass Knuckles
weapons.notes: A hero wearing brass knuckles is considered to be an Unarmed Defender (see page 108)

weapons.name: Chainsaw
weapons.notes: A natural 1 on the Fighting die hits the user instead

weapons.name: Survival Knife
weapons.notes: Contains supplies that add +1 to Survival rolls

weapons.name: Net (Weighted)
weapons.notes: A successful hit means the target is Entangled (see page 98). The net is Hardness 10 and vulnerable only to cutting attacks.

weapons.name: Blunderbuss
weapons.notes: Reload 2, Treat as Shotgun, see page 7page 105.

weapons.name: Kentucky Rifle
weapons.notes: Reload 3, The tight rifling requires four actions to reload instead of the usual two.

weapons.name: M-16 (5.56mm)
weapons.notes: The A-2 version can also fire a Three-Round Burst (see page 66).

weapons.name: Browning Automatic Rifle (BAR) (.30-06)
weapons.notes: ROF 1-3. Uses magazines (one action to Reload instead of the usual 2).

weapons.name: Smoke Grenade
weapons.notes: Creates an area of smoke in a LBT that obscures vision (–4).

weapons.name: Stun Grenade
weapons.notes: Targets must make a Vigor roll (at –2 with a raise) or be Stunned (see page 106).

weapons.name: Crossbow, Heavy
weapons.notes: Requires a windlass to load. Reload 2

weapons.name: Club, Light
weapons.notes: A sign of low status or thuggery

weapons.name: Club, Heavy

effects.name: Construct
effects.description: Androids add +2 to recover from being Shaken, don’t suffer wound modifiers, and are immune to poison and disease. Androids cannot heal naturally. To heal an android requires the Repair skill—which is used like the Healing skill only with no “Golden Hour.

effects.name: Asimov Circuits
effects.description: The android cannot harm, or by inaction bring harm to sentient beings. This gives him the Pacifist Hindrance (Major)

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Organic races often mistrust or misunderstand androids. They subtract 2 from their Charisma when dealing with races other than their own.

effects.name: Programming
effects.description: Androids begin with a free d6 in one skill, representing their original programmed role

effects.name: Recharge
effects.description: During character creation, the player must determine the android’s power source. If the android cannot access his power source at least once per day, he’s automatically Fatigued each day until he’s Incapacitated. The day after that, he goes “off-line” and must be revived with a Repair roll and a four-hour charge of energy. The power source replaces the need for food and water, unless they are the chosen power source.

effects.name: Unnatural
effects.description: Arcane powers, both detrimental and beneficial, suffer a –2 penalty to affect androids. This has no effect on damaging powers, which affect them normally.

effects.name: Advanced Civilization
effects.description: Atlanteans are generally more intelligent than the other races of their world. They start with a d6 in Smarts rather than a d4.

effects.name: Aquatic
effects.description: Atlanteans live in and breathe water. They cannot drown in water, move at full Swimming skill, and get a free d6 Swimming.

effects.name: Dehydration
effects.description: Atlanteans must immerse themselves in water one hour out of every 24 or become automatically Fatigued each day until they are Incapacitated. The day after that, they perish.

effects.name: Tough
effects.description: The pressure of their deep homes make Atlanteans tougher than most. Increase Toughness by 1.

effects.name: Flight
effects.description: Avions can fly at their basic Pace and even “run” while flying. It costs 2” of Pace to gain 1” of height.

effects.name: Hollow-boned
effects.description: Avions have –1 Toughness.

effects.name: Mostly Human
effects.description: Avions may choose one free Edge at character creation as long as they meet all requirements

effects.name: Agile
effects.description: Elves are graceful and agile. They start with a d6 in Agility instead of a d4

effects.name: All Thumbs
effects.description: Elves have an inbred dislike of mechanical objects, and thus have the All Thumbs Hindrance. They shun most mechanical items and designs.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Elven eyes amplify light like a cat’s, allowing them to see in the dark. Elves ignores attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Dwarven eyes are accustomed to the dark of the underearth. They ignore attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting

effects.name: Slow
effects.description: Dwarves have a Pace of 5”.

effects.name: Tough
effects.description: Dwarves are stout and tough. They start with a d6 Vigor instead of a d4.

effects.name: Elven Heritage
effects.description: Some half-elves retain the grace of their elven parent.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: The character’s eyes amplify light like a cat’s, allowing him to see in the dark. He ignores attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Half-elves aren’t true outsiders (as per the Hindrance of the same name), but neither are they ever quite comfortable around humans or elves as one of their own, so the effect is the same.

effects.name: Human Heritage
effects.description: Some half-elves gain the adaptability of their human ancestry

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: The character’s eyes amplify light like a cat’s, allowing him to see in the dark. He ignores attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Half-elves aren’t true outsiders (as per the Hindrance of the same name), but neither are they ever quite comfortable around humans or elves as one of their own, so the effect is the same.

effects.name: Fortunate
effects.description: Half-folk draw one additional Benny per game session. This may be combined with the Luck and Great Luck Edges.

effects.name: Short
effects.description: Half-folk average only about 4’ tall. This gives them a Size of –1 and subtracts 1 from their Toughness.

effects.name: Spirited
effects.description: Half-folk are generally optimistic beings. They start with a d6 Spirit instead of a d4.

effects.name: Infravision
effects.description: Half-orcs can see in the infrared spectrum, halving attack penalties (round down) for bad lighting

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Half-orcs aren’t trusted by most other civilized races, and so subtract 2 from their Charisma.

effects.name: Strong
effects.description: Half-orcs have some of the strength of their ancestry. They start with a d6 Strength attribute instead of a d4.

effects.name: Agile
effects.description: Rakashans have the feline grace of their ancestors. They start with a d6 Agility attribute instead of a d4.

effects.name: Bloodthirsty
effects.description: Rakashans can be cruel to their foes, often toying with them for simple amusement. They rarely take prisoners and feel little compunction about punishing captured foes. This causes a –4 Charisma penalty among more “civilized” types.

effects.name: Racial Enemy
effects.description: Rakashan society rose at the expense of another. Pick a common race in your setting. Members of each culture suffer a –4 Charisma when dealing with each other. Unless fettered by other authorities or common goals, individuals of the two races typically attack each other on sight.

effects.name: Claws
effects.description: Rakashans have retractable claws that do Str+d6 damage and grant +2 to Climbing rolls on all but completely sheer surfaces.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Rakashan eyes amplify light. They can see in the dark and ignore attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Most races distrust the unblinking saurians. Their habit of eating their meat still squirming is also less than appetizing. They suffer a –2 Charisma penalty.

effects.name: Natural Weapons
effects.description: The tails, claws, and teeth of saurians allow them to tail slap, claw, or bite in combat for Str+d4 damage.

effects.name: Saurian Senses
effects.description: Saurians’ lizard tongues can “taste” the air, giving them +2 to Notice rolls. They are always considered active guards for Stealth checks

effects.name: Warm Natured
effects.description: Though not truly cold-blooded, saurians are not comfortable in cold environments. They suffer a –4 penalty to resist cold environmental effects.

effects.name: Extra Edge
effects.description: A human starts off with an extra edge

effects.name: Adaptable
effects.description: Humans begin play with any Novice Edge of their choosing. They must meet its Requirements as usual.

effects.name: Construct
effects.description: Androids add +2 to recover from being Shaken, don’t breathe, ignore one level of Wound modifiers, and are immune to poison and disease. Constructs cannot heal naturally. Healing one requires the Repair skill—which is treated like Healing but not limited to the “Golden Hour” (see page 96).

effects.name: Pacifist (Major)
effects.description: Unless the android is designed for combat, most advanced  societies require the installation of “Asimov Circuits,” a concept based on science fiction writer Isaac Asimov’s “First Law of Robotics.” The artificial being may not injure a sapient being, or through action or inaction, allow such a being to be harmed. This gives them the Pacifist (Major) Hindrance.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Organic races often mistrust or misunderstand androids. They subtract 2 from their Charisma when dealing with races other than their own.

effects.name: Vow (Major)
effects.description: Constructs are designed with a particular purpose. Player character constructs have broad directives such as serving a particular corporation or political faction. This acts as a Major Vow to that particular directive. If this ever causes a conflict of interest, the player and GM must figure out what the construct’s programming requires.

effects.name: Aquatic
effects.description: Aquarians cannot drown in water and move at their full Pace when swimming. See Movement in Combat on page 92 for normal swimming rates.

effects.name: Dependency
effects.description: Aquarians must immerse themselves in water one hour out of every 24 or become automatically Fatigued each day until they are Incapacitated. The day after Incapacitation from dehydration, they perish. Each hour spent in water restores one level of Fatigue.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Aquarians are used to the darkness of the depths. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

effects.name: Toughness
effects.description: Life in the depths of their watery worlds has made aquarian flesh tough and resilient. Add +1 to their Toughness.

effects.name: Flight
effects.description: Avions fly at Pace 12 per round. Use Athletics when maneuvering.

effects.name: Frail
effects.description: Avions have −1 Toughness due to their hollow bones.

effects.name: Reduced Pace
effects.description: Dependence on flight and bulky wings make avions slightly slower when walking. Decrease their Pace by 1 and their running die by one step.

effects.name: Keen Senses
effects.description: Avions are more perceptive than most. They begin with a d6 in Notice (instead of d4) and may raise the skill to d12 + 1.

effects.name: Can't Swim
effects.description: Avions’ wings are a hazard in water. They subtract 2 from Athletics (swimming) rolls and each inch moved in water costs them 3′′ of Pace.

effects.name: Agile
effects.description: Elves are graceful and agile. They start with a d6 in Agility instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12+1.

effects.name: All Thumbs
effects.description: Elves have an inherent dislike of mechanical objects, and thus have the All Thumbs Hindrance. They shun most mechanical items and designs.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Elven eyes amplify light. Other races often claim they can see stars in the elves’ eyes. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Dwarven eyes are accustomed to the dark of the underearth. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

effects.name: Reduced Pace
effects.description: Dwarves have short legs compared to most races. Decrease their Pace by 1 and their running die one die type.

effects.name: Tough
effects.description: Dwarves are stout and tough. They start with a d6 Vigor instead of a d4. This increases maximum Vigor to d12+1.

effects.name: Elven Heritage
effects.description: Some half-elves retain the grace of their elven parent.

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Half-elves ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Half-elves are never quite comfortable in human or elven society, having a foot in both worlds but never fully standing in either. Because of this, they suffer a −1 penalty to Persuasion with all but others of their kind.

effects.name: Human Heritage
effects.description: Some half-elves gain the adaptability of their human ancestry

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: The character’s eyes amplify light like a cat’s, allowing him to see in the dark. He ignores attack penalties for Dim and Dark lighting.

effects.name: Outsider
effects.description: Half-elves are never quite comfortable in human or elven society, having a foot in both worlds but never fully standing in either. Because of this, they suffer a −1 penalty to Persuasion with all but others of their kind.

effects.name: Size -1
effects.description: Half-folk average only about four feet tall, reducing their Size (and therefore Toughness) by 1.

effects.name: Luck
effects.description:
Half-folk draw one additional
Benny per game session.

effects.name: Reduced Pace
effects.description: Decrease the character’s Pace by 1 and their running die one die type.

effects.name: Spirited
effects.description: Half-folk are generally optimistic beings. They start with a d6 Spirit instead of a d4. This increases their maximum Spirit to d12 + 1.

effects.name: Agile
effects.description: Feline grace gives rakashans a d6 Agility attribute instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12+1.

effects.name: Bloodthirsty
effects.description: Rakashans can be cruel to their foes, often toying with them for simple amusement. They rarely take prisoners and feel little compunction about punishing captured foes.

effects.name: Racial Enemy
effects.description: Rakashan society rose at the expense of another. Pick a common race in your setting. Members of each culture subtract 2 from Persuasion when dealing with each other and often attack on sight.

effects.name: Claw/Bite
effects.description: Rakashan claws mean they never count as an Unarmed Defender (page 108) and cause Str+d4 damage. They add +2 to Athletics rolls when climbing and increase climbing movement to their full Pace. Their bite causes Str+d4 damage and can also be used on a Bound or Entangled foe (see page 98).

effects.name: Low Light Vision
effects.description: Rakashan eyes amplify light. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark Illumination.

effects.name: Can't Swim
effects.description: Rakashans actually can swim, they just shun it and are not particularly good at it. Subtract 2 from Athletics rolls made to swim.

effects.name: Outsider (minor)
effects.description: Most races distrust saurians for some reason. Perhaps it is their strange ways and customs, their often-sibilant speech, or an ancient subconscious fear of their reptilian ancestors. Saurians suffer a −1 penalty to Persuasion with all but others of their kind.

effects.name: Bite
effects.description: A saurian’s bite causes Str+d4 damage and can also be used on a Bound or Entangled foe (see page 98).

effects.name: Keen Senses
effects.description: Saurians have acute senses, giving them the Alertness Edge.

effects.name: Armor +2
effects.description: Though not truly cold-blooded, saurians are not comfortable in cold environments. They suffer a –4 penalty to resist cold environmental effects.

effects.name: Environmental Weakness
effects.description: Saurians have scaly skin that acts as leather armor.

race_abilities.name: Adaptable
race_abilities.summary: The race has great variation among its people and cultures. Characters start with a free Novice Edge of their choice (and must meet all the Edge’s Requirements).

race_abilities.name: Additional Action
race_abilities.summary: The being has additional appendages, enhanced reflexes, or exceptional eye-hand coordination. He may ignore 2 points of Multi-Action penalties each turn.

race_abilities.name: Semi-Aquatic
race_abilities.summary: The character is semi-aquatic and can hold breath for 15 minutes before checking for drowning.

race_abilities.name: Aquatic
race_abilities.summary: Native to the water. Cannot drown in oxygenated liquid and moves at full Pace when swimming

race_abilities.name: Armor
race_abilities.summary: The species has a thick hide or is encrusted in solid material like scaly plating or even rock. This grants Armor +2 each time it’s taken.

race_abilities.name: Attribute Increase
race_abilities.summary: During character creation, the species increases a particular attribute (Agility, Smarts, Spirit, Strength, or Vigor) one die type. This increases the Trait’s maximum by one as well.

race_abilities.name: Bite
race_abilities.summary: The race has fangs that cause Strength+d4 damage and can also be used on a Bound or Entangled foe

race_abilities.name: Claws (d4)
race_abilities.summary: The race has claws that cause Str+d4 damage (this stacks with Edges like Bruiser or Martial Artist). They never count as an Unarmed Defender (page 108), add +2 to Athletics (climbing) rolls, and may climb at their full Pace.

race_abilities.name: Claws (d6)
race_abilities.summary: The race has claws that cause Str+d4 damage (this stacks with Edges like Bruiser or Martial Artist). They never count as an Unarmed Defender (page 108), add +2 to Athletics (climbing) rolls, and may climb at their full Pace.

race_abilities.name: Claws (d6 AP2)
race_abilities.summary: The race has claws that cause Str+d4 damage (this stacks with Edges like Bruiser or Martial Artist). They never count as an Unarmed Defender (page 108), add +2 to Athletics (climbing) rolls, and may climb at their full Pace.

race_abilities.name: Burrowing
race_abilities.summary: The species developed underground. The character can burrow into loose earth and move through it at half normal Pace (he cannot run). He cannot normally be attacked while burrowing, and can attempt to surprise opponents who didn’t see him coming by making an opposed Stealth vs. Notice roll. If successful, the burrower adds +2 to his attack and damage rolls that round, or +4 with a raise (he has The Drop, page 100).

race_abilities.name: Construct
race_abilities.summary: Constructs are artificial beings made of inorganic material. They add +2 to recover from being Shaken, ignore one level of Wound modifiers, don’t breathe, and are immune to disease and poison. Wounds must be mended via the Repair skill (and ignore the “Golden Hour”). Many Constructs have the Dependency Negative Racial Ability as well (reflecting their need for a power source).

race_abilities.name: Doesn't Breathe
race_abilities.summary: The species does not breathe. Individuals aren’t affected by inhaled toxins, can’t drown, and don’t suffocate in a vacuum. (They may still freeze, however.)

race_abilities.name: Edge
race_abilities.summary: All members of this race have the same innate Edge chosen from those available in the setting. Unlike Adaptable, this ability ignores Requirements except other Edges. Each Rank beyond Novice costs an additional point to a maximum of Heroic Rank (5).

race_abilities.name: Environmental Resistance
race_abilities.summary: The species receives a +4 bonus to resist a single negative environmental effect, such as heat, cold, lack of air, radiation, etc. This also counts as Armor against attacks based on that element or effect.

race_abilities.name: Flight (Pace 6)
race_abilities.summary: The species can fly at a Pace of 6 per round, and “run” for extra movement as usual. Maneuvering uses the Athletics skill. Racial flight presumes some kind of wings which can be targeted or fouled (a Bound or Entangled character cannot fly).

race_abilities.name: Flight (Pace 24)
race_abilities.summary: The being can fly at Pace 24 and may “run” for 2d6” of additional movement. Maneuvering uses the Athletics skill. Racial flight presumes some kind of wings which can be targeted or fouled (a Bound or Entangled character cannot fly).

race_abilities.name: Hardy
race_abilities.summary: A second Shaken result in combat does not cause a Wound.

race_abilities.name: Immune to Poison
race_abilities.summary: The species is immune to poison.

race_abilities.name: Immune to Disease
race_abilities.summary: The species is immune to disease.

race_abilities.name: Infravision
race_abilities.summary: The creature detects and “sees” heat, either through eyes or other sensory organs. This allows it to halve penalties for bad lighting when attacking targets that radiate heat.

race_abilities.name: Leaper
race_abilities.summary: The character can jump twice as far as listed in the movement section on page 92. In addition, he adds +4 to damage when leaping as part of a Wild Attack instead of the usual +2 (unless in a closed or confined space where he cannot leap horizontally or vertically—GM’s call).

race_abilities.name: Low Light Vision
race_abilities.summary: The being ignores penalties for Dim or Dark lighting (but not Pitch Darkness).

race_abilities.name: No Vital Organs
race_abilities.summary: These species have hidden, extremely tough, or redundant vital organs. Called Shots do no extra damage against them.

race_abilities.name: Pace
race_abilities.summary: The character’s Pace is increased by +2 and his running die is increased a die type.

race_abilities.name: Parry
race_abilities.summary: The creature’s natural Parry is increased by +1. This may be due to a prehensile tail, extra limbs, enhanced reflexes, or even latent psi-sense.

race_abilities.name: Poisonous Touch (Mild)
race_abilities.summary: With a successful Touch Attack (page 108), bite, or claw, the victim must roll Vigor or suffer the effects of Mild Poison.The character may always choose whether or not to use her poison touch. See page 128 for Poison and its effects.

race_abilities.name: Poisonous Touch (Fatal, Lethal, or Paralyzing)
race_abilities.summary: With a successful Touch Attack (page 108), bite, or claw, the victim must roll Vigor or suffer the effects of  Fatal, Lethal, or Paralyzing, but each use causes the hero Fatigue. The character may always choose whether or not to use her poison touch. See page 128 for Poison and its effects.

race_abilities.name: Reach
race_abilities.summary: Long limbs, tentacles, etc. grant the creature Reach +1 (add +1 each time it’s taken after the first).

race_abilities.name: Regeneration
race_abilities.summary: The being heals damage quickly. She may make a natural healing roll once per day (rather than once per week).

race_abilities.name: Size +1
race_abilities.summary: The creature is larger than normal. Each point of Size adds directly to Toughness. Large species may have difficulty using equipment designed for more traditional humanoids. See page 105 for more on Size.

race_abilities.name: Skill (d4)
race_abilities.summary: The character starts with a d4 in a skill inherent to her race.

race_abilities.name: Skill (d6)
race_abilities.summary: The character starts with a d6 in a skill inherent to her race and the skill’s maximum increases to d12+1.

race_abilities.name: Sleep Reduction (half)
race_abilities.summary: The being needs half the normal amount of sleep as humans.

race_abilities.name: Sleep Reduction (Doesn't Sleep)
race_abilities.summary: The being never sleeps.

race_abilities.name: Toughness
race_abilities.summary: The character has hardened skin, scales, or extremely dense tissue that increases his base Toughness by +1.

race_abilities.name: Wall Walker
race_abilities.summary: The species may walk on vertical surfaces normally, or inverted surfaces at half Pace.

race_abilities.name: Super Power
race_abilities.summary: The race has truly extraordinary abilities taken from the Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion. The cost is 2—for Arcane Background (Super Powers)—plus the actual cost of the power selected (X). Make sure you have the GM’s permission before taking this powerful ability.

race_abilities.name: Power
race_abilities.summary: The race has an innate ability that functions like a power. For 2 points, she has Arcane Background (Gifted) and a power that reflects her unusual ability. Each time this is taken after the first costs 1 point and grants another power. It does not increase her Power Points—use the Power Points Edge for that.

race_abilities.name: Attribute Penalty (-1)
race_abilities.summary: One attribute suffers a –1 penalty to all rolls (including damage if applied to Strength).

race_abilities.name: Attribute Penalty (-2)
race_abilities.summary: One attribute suffers a –2 penalty to all rolls (including damage if applied to Strength).

race_abilities.name: Big
race_abilities.summary: The being is very large (he must also be least Size 2, see Size on page 105). He subtracts 2 when using equipment designed for smaller beings and cannot wear their armor or clothing. Equipment, armor, food, and clothing cost double the listed price.

race_abilities.name: Cannot Speak
race_abilities.summary: Either the race has no vocal cords or it cannot form the normal sounds made by most other races. He can communicate with members of his own race naturally (perhaps through song, pheromones, body language, etc.). Other races can’t speak his language either since they can’t replicate the proper sounds. The species can hear and understand other typical languages, however, and may communicate via electronic devices or the like.

race_abilities.name: Dependency
race_abilities.summary: The creature must consume or have contact with some sort of relatively common substance. Creatures from water-based worlds, for example, might need to immerse themselves in water one hour out of every 24; plant people might need an hour of sunlight a day. If they don’t have the required contact, they become Fatigued each day until they’re Incapacitated. A day after that, they perish. Each hour spent recovering with the appropriate substance restores a level of Fatigue.

race_abilities.name: Environmental Weakness
race_abilities.summary: The race suffers a –4 penalty to resist a particular environmental effect, such as heat, cold, etc. If the being suffers an attack based on that form, the penalty acts as a bonus to damage.

race_abilities.name: Frail
race_abilities.summary: The creature is less durable than most. Reduce its Toughness by 1.

race_abilities.name: Poor Parry
race_abilities.summary: The race is slow to react in combat for some reason; –1 Parry.

race_abilities.name: Racial Enemy
race_abilities.summary: This species dislikes another species relatively common to the setting. They suffer a –2 penalty to Persuasion rolls when dealing with their rivals and may become hostile with little provocation. This may only be taken once per race.

race_abilities.name: Reduced Core Skills
race_abilities.summary: This race starts with one less core skill. The skill may be gained normally but does not start at a d4. This may be taken once per core skill affected

race_abilities.name: Reduced Pace (-1)
race_abilities.summary: For –1 point, reduce Pace by 1 and the running die is a d4.

race_abilities.name: Reduced Pace (-2)
race_abilities.summary: Reduce Pace by 2, the running die is a d4, and subtract 2 from Athletics and rolls to resist Athletics where movement and mobility are integral to the challenge (GM’s call).

race_abilities.name: Size -1
race_abilities.summary: The entity is smaller than average, reducing its Size and Toughness by 1.

race_abilities.name: Skill Penalty (-1)
race_abilities.summary: The race suffers a –1 penalty to one skill

race_abilities.name: Skill Penalty (-2)
race_abilities.summary: The race suffers a –2 penalty to one skill

race_abilities.name: Hindrance
race_abilities.summary: The creature has a built-in Minor Hindrance for 1 point, or a Major Hindrance for 2. This doesn’t affect the ability to choose other Hindrances during character creation.

race_abilities.name: Claws (d4 AP2)
race_abilities.summary: The race has claws that count as weapons and cause Str+d4 damage (this stacks with Edges like Bruiser or Martial Artist). They add +2 to Athletics (climbing) rolls, and may climb at their full Pace. One more point may be spent to increase their damage to Strength+d6, and / or another to add AP 2.

race_abilities.name: Flight (Pace 12)
race_abilities.summary: The species can fly at a Pace of 12 per round, and “run” for extra movement as usual. Maneuvering uses the Athletics skill. Racial flight presumes some kind of wings which can be targeted or fouled (a Bound or Entangled character cannot fly).

race_abilities.name: Horns (d4)
race_abilities.summary: The being has a horn or horns that cause Str+d4 damage, Add +4 damage at the end of one Fighting action in which it Runs, moves at least 5′′(10 yards), and successfully hits with its horns.

race_abilities.name: Horns (d6)
race_abilities.summary: The being has a horn or horns that cause Str+d4 damage. Add +4 damage at the end of one Fighting action in which it Runs, moves at least 5′′(10 yards), and successfully hits with its horns.

race_abilities.name: Skill Bonus (+2)
race_abilities.summary: For 2 points, the character has a +2 bonus when using a particular skill (this may only be taken once per skill).

arcane_backgrounds.name: Magic
description: Magicians range from powerful wizards to vile cultists. They draw on raw supernatural energy to fuel their eldritch fires. This energy often infuses the worlds in which they live, and is drawn forth with elaborate rituals, words of power, runes, or perhaps even dark sacrifices. Wizards are often quite weak early in their careers, but are forces to be reckoned with as
backlash_description: When a wizard rolls a 1 on his Spellcasting die (regardless of his Wild Die), he is automatically Shaken. This can cause a wound.

arcane_backgrounds.name: Miracles
description: Those who draw on miracles are priestly types or holy champions. Their power comes from a divine presence of some sort, including gods, nature, or spirits. Their powers are usually invoked with a few words of prayer or by performing established rituals.
backlash_description: Those who cast miracles are champions of their particular religions. Good priests vow to protect the innocent, fight evil, and obey all other tenets of their particular religion. Evil priests typically vow to defeat those who oppose their religion, or simply to cause as much misery and strife as possible. The player and Game Master should come up with a simple list of what is important to the character’s religion and use this as a guide.

Champions who violate their beliefs are temporarily or permanently forsaken by their chosen deity. Minor sins give the character a –2 to his Faith rolls for one week. Major sins rob him of all arcane powers for one week. Mortal sins cause the character to be forsaken until the penitent hero completes some great quest or task of atonement to regain his lost powers.

arcane_backgrounds.name: Super Powers
description: Characters with super powers gain their abilities through strange circumstances, such as being bitten by irradiated creatures, exposure to strange chemicals, or perhaps by finding alien artifacts. This particular level of power is intended for relatively low-level “pulp” heroes. More powerful super types are dealt with in specific Savage Settings, and you’ll find an alternate and far more detailed system in our Super Powers Companion.

Super powers work a little differently from most other Arcane Backgrounds—each power is its own skill and has no linked attribute (and thus counts as “lower” than its linked Attribute for purposes of Advancement). A hero with the armor and bolt powers, for example, also has an Armor and a Bolt skill he uses to enable it. It’s more expensive for a character to improve his powers, but he starts with more Power Points than other arcane types so he can use his abilities more often. Best of all, there are no drawbacks for super powers as there are with other types of arcane powers—the power either works or it doesn’t.

arcane_backgrounds.name: Weird Science
description: Weird Science is the creation of strange and powerful devices. It differs from regular science in that some element of the arcane is involved. Maybe it’s just generic “super-science,” or perhaps it’s divinely (or demonically) inspired. Maybe the science itself is relatively sound, but it derives power from an arcane source, such as ghost rock in Deadlands, or some other magical mineral or essence in a steampunk fantasy game.

Weird Science is different in that each new power is actually a new “gizmo.” The player must write down exactly what the device is when he gains the power. An inventor with the invisibility power, for instance, actually has an invisibility belt, cloak, etc. Players are encouraged to give their devices pseudo-scientific names as well (“Dr. Zee’s Chromatic Disfibulating Device!”). Weird Science is the skill an inventor uses when activating most devices, and raises increase the effects of the power as usual. If a device uses a different skill, such as Driving, Fighting, or Shooting, the inventor uses that instead. A ray gun, for example, uses the Shooting skill, while a “vibroknife” (a knife with the smite power) uses Fighting.
Powers that require an opposed roll, such as puppet, also use the scientist’s Weird Science skill.

Each device comes with its own Power Points equal to the inventor’s Power Points. An inventor with the bolt power and 10 Power Points, for example, could make a ray gun that fires electrical beams. The gun has 10 Power Points it can use to fire the beams just like a wizard would cast the bolt spell.
backlash_description: Weird science devices are never perfect technology. They often suffer from spectacular and deadly malfunctions. If a gadgeteer uses a device and rolls a 1 on the skill die used to activate the gizmo, it has malfunctioned in some way and does not work. Draw a card and consult the Malfunction Table

arcane_backgrounds.name: Psionics
description: Psionicists have discovered how to tap into their own psychic powers. They can manipulate matter, create fire, or control their own bodies with but a thought.
backlash_description: When a psionic character rolls a 1 on his Psionics die (regardless of his Wild Die), he is automatically Shaken. On a critical failure, the psi lets out a psychic scream that causes him to be Shaken along with all allies in a Large Burst Template who fail a Spirit roll. This can cause a wound.

powers.name: Arcane Protection
powers.summary: Enemy casters subtract 2 (4 with a raise) when targeting this character; reduces damage a like amount.
powers.trappings: Concentration, a dull glow around the protected character, a fetish.
additional_targets: The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Banish
powers.summary: Opposed roll vs Spirit to banish entities.
powers.trappings: Holy items, arcane symbols, handful of salt.

powers.name: Barrier
powers.summary: Creates 10 yard long, 2 yard tall, Toughness 10 barrier.
powers.trappings: Fire, ice, thorns, force, bones, energy.
additional_effects: DAMAGE (+1): The barrier causes 2d4 damage to anyone who contacts it.
SHAPED (+2): The barrier forms a circle, square or other basic shape.
SIZE (+1): The length and height of the barrier doubles.
STRONG (+1): The wall is Toughness 12.

powers.name: Beast Friend
powers.trappings: The caster concentrates and gestures with his hands.
additional_effects: Mind Rider: The caster can communicate and sense through and of the beasts he's befriended

powers.name: Blast
powers.trappings: Balls of fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, swarm of insects.
additional_effects: Area Effect (0/+1): The caster can focus the blast to a Small Blast Template for no extra cost, or a Large Blast Template for +1.
Damage (+2): The blast causes 3d6 damage (4d6 with a raise).

powers.name: Blind
powers.trappings: Bright flash of light, sand in eyes, confusion.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.
STRONG (+1): The Vigor roll to shake off the effect is made at −2.

powers.name: Bolt
powers.trappings: Fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, a stream of insects.
additional_effects: DAMAGE (+2): The bolt causes 3d6 damage (4d6 with a raise).

powers.name: Boost/Lower Trait
powers.summary: Increases or decreases a skill or attribute.
powers.trappings: Physical change, glowing aura, potions
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
STRONG (+1): The Spirit roll to shake off the effect is made at −2.

powers.name: Burrow
powers.trappings: Dissolving into the earth and appearing elsewhere.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1additional Power Point each.
POWER (+1): The caster can burrow through stone, concrete, or similar substances. (Some substances, like plastic, glass, solid lead, etc., might be resistant at the GM’s discretion.)

powers.name: Confusion
powers.trappings: Hypnotic lights, brief illusions, loud noises.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.

powers.name: Damage Field
powers.trappings: Fiery aura, spikes, electrical field.
additional_effects: DAMAGE (+2): The damage field causes 2d6 damage

powers.name: Darksight
powers.trappings: Glowing eyes, dilated pupils, sonic sight.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Deflection
powers.trappings: Mystical shield, gust of wind, phantom servant that intercepts missiles.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Burst
powers.trappings: A shower of flames, light, or other matter or energy.
additional_effects: DAMAGE (+2): The burst causes 3d6 damage, or 4d6 with a raise.

powers.name: Detect/Conceal Arcana
powers.summary: Detects magic for Duration 5 or conceals it for one hour.
powers.trappings: Waving hands, whispered words
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
AREA OF EFFECT (+1/+2): The power affects everything in a sphere the size of a Medium Blast Template for +1 points, or a Large Blast Template for +2.
STRONG (+1): Conceal only. Detection rolls to see through the concealment are made at −2.

powers.name: Disguise
powers.trappings: Malleable features, illusionary appearance, hair of new form.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
SIZE (+1): The recipient may assume the shape of someone up to two Sizes larger or smaller than themselves.

powers.name: Dispel
powers.trappings: Waving hands, whispered words
additional_effects: POWER (+1): For +1 Power Points, dispel can disrupt enchanted devices for one round, or two with a raise. The difficulty to do so is −2 for permanently enchanted items such as found in most swords & sorcery campaigns, or −4 for divine or legendary relics.

powers.name: Divination
powers.duration: A brief conversation of about five minutes.
powers.trappings: Seances, prayers, demonic interrogation.

powers.name: Drain Power Points
powers.summary: Drains d6 Power Points from enemy with successful opposed roll of arcane skills.
powers.trappings: Prayer, whispered words, gestures.
additional_effects: FATIGUE (+1): If the power is successful the target is Fatigued.

powers.name: Elemental Manipulation
powers.summary: Allows minor manipulation of basic elements.
powers.trappings: A few simple gestures
additional_effects: AIR: Push someone, blow out a torch, fan a flame, cool someone down (+2 to Fatigue rolls in oppressive heat).
EARTH: Move a square foot of earth (half that in stone) each round, spray sand in an opponent’s eyes (+1 to a Test).
FIRE: Conjure flame about the size of a torch, hurl a small blast of fire at someone (Str damage), spread existing flame (see Fire on page 127).
WATER: Conjure a quart of water (not “inside” objects or people), purify a gallon of water per casting.

powers.name: Empathy
powers.summary: Opposed roll vs Spirit to add +2 to social attacks for the Duration of the power.
powers.trappings: Concentration, a warm or sympathetic smile, a skull cap.

powers.name: Entangle
powers.trappings: Glue bomb, vines, handcuffs, webs.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.
STRONG (+2): The entangling material is particularly resilient. Rolls to break free are made at −2 and its Toughness increases to 7.

powers.name: Environmental Protection
powers.trappings: A mark on the forehead, potions, gills.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Farsight
powers.summary: See detail at great distance; halves Range penalties with a raise
powers.trappings: Invisibly marked targets, guiding winds, eagle eyes.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Fear
powers.trappings: Gestures, eldritch energy, cold chills.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.

powers.name: Fly
powers.trappings: Gusty winds, wings, broomsticks.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+2): The power may affect more than one target for 2 additional Power Points each.

powers.name: Growth/Shrink
powers.trappings: Gestures, words of power, potions.

powers.name: Havoc
powers.summary: Targets in MBT are Distracted and may be hurled.
powers.trappings: Whirlwind, chaotic poltergeists, repulsion field.
additional_effects: AREA EFFECT (+1): Havoc affects a Large Blast Template.
STRONG (+1): Strength rolls are made at −2.

powers.name: Healing
powers.trappings: Laying on hands, touching the victim with a holy symbol, prayer.
additional_effects: GREATER HEALING (+10): Greater healing can restore any Wound, including those more than an hour old.

CRIPPLING INJURIES (+20): The power can heal a permanent Crippling Injury (see Incapacitation, page 95). This requires an hour of preparation and only one casting is permitted per injury. If it fails, this caster cannot heal that particular injury (but someone else may try). If successful, the subject is Exhausted for 24 hours.

NEUTRALIZE POISON OR DISEASE (+1): A successful healing roll negates any poison or disease. If the poison or disease has a bonus or penalty associated with it, the modifier applies to the arcane skill roll as well.

powers.name: Illusion
powers.trappings: Magical spells, holograms, “ethereal materializers.”
additional_effects: SOUND (+1): The power generates sound appropriate to the illusion. Illusionary allies may talk, illusionary crows caw, and so on. It may not mask or mute existing sound, however.
STRONG (+2): Smarts rolls to disbelieve the illusion are made at −2.

powers.name: Intangibility
powers.trappings: Ghost form, body of shadow, gaseous transformation

powers.name: Invisibility
powers.trappings: Powder, potion, iridescent lights.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+3): The power may affect more than one target for 3 additional Power Points each.

powers.name: Light/Darkness
powers.trappings: Illusionary torch, sunlight, darkness, thick fogs.
additional_effects: MOBILE (+1): The caster can move the area of effect up to his arcane skill die type each round.

powers.name: Mind Link
powers.summary: Mental link within one mile (5 with raise).
powers.trappings: Headpieces, talismans of Tao or other gods, crystals.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect additional individuals for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Mind Reading
powers.summary: Opposed roll vs Smarts to read mind.
powers.trappings: Psionic invasion, soulsight

powers.name: Mind Wipe
powers.trappings: A noxious drink, parasites, touching the target’s temples.
additional_effects: EDIT (+1): Instead of wiping the memory, the caster edits it as she sees fit instead.
FAST CAST (+2): The caster can wipe a memory as an action.

powers.name: Object Reading
powers.summary: Reveals last five years of an object’s history (100 years with a raise).
powers.trappings: Touching the object, glowing hands
additional_effects: AUDIBLE HISTORY (+2): The caster can now hear sounds and conversations as well.

powers.name: Protection
powers.trappings: A mystical glow, hardened skin, ethereal armor, a mass of nanites.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect additional targets at a cost of 1 Power Point each.
MORE ARMOR (+1): Success grants 4 points of Armor (+6 with a raise).
TOUGHNESS (+2): Protection provides Toughness instead of Armor and is not affected by AP (magical or otherwise). This means it stacks with natural or worn armor.

powers.name: Puppet
powers.summary: Opposed roll vs Spirit to control target.
powers.trappings: Glowing eyes, trance-like state, a swinging pocket watch, voodoo dolls.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+2): The caster may affect others at the cost of 2 Power Points each.

powers.name: Relief
powers.trappings: Prayer, Tonics
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Resurrection
powers.summary: Brings the dead back to life.
powers.trappings: Elaborate ceremonies, rare plants, magical amulets, divine intervention
additional_effects: POWER (+5): The hero can raise a spirit dead up to a decade for +5 Power Points.

powers.name: Shape Change
powers.summary: Caster takes on the form of various beings.
powers.trappings: “Morphing,” talismans, tattoos.

powers.name: Sloth/Speed
powers.trappings: Slowing time, blurred motion, a slippery patch of oil or ice.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): Speed only. The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): Sloth only. For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.
QUICKNESS (+2): Speed only. The character’s total Multi-Action penalty each turn is reduced by 2 (she can do two actions at no penalty or three at −2 each).
STRONG (+1): Sloth only. The Spirit roll to shake off sloth’s effects is made at −2.

powers.name: Slumber
powers.trappings: A lullaby, blowing powder or Silence does the opposite, muting all sound sand at targets.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.

powers.name: Smite
powers.trappings: A colored glow, runes, sigils, crackling energy, barbs grow from the blade.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Sound/Silence
powers.trappings: Magical effects, a brief ripple in the air, a bell or chime that starts or stops ringing.
additional_effects: MOBILE (+1): The caster can move the area of effect up to his arcane skill die type each round.

TARGETED (+1): Instead of casting silence in an area of effect, the caster may instead target individuals in Range for 1 Power Point each. Each victim resists with Spirit (at −2 if the power is activated with a raise).

powers.name: Speak Language
powers.summary: Caster can speak and understand languages.
powers.trappings: Words, pictures, hand motions.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Stun
powers.trappings: Bolts of energy, stun bombs, sonic booms, burst of blinding light.
additional_effects: AREA OF EFFECT (+2/+3): For +2 points the power affects everyone in a Medium Blast Template. For +3 points the area of effect is increased to a Large Blast Template.

powers.name: Summon Ally
powers.summary: Conjures an ally of various sorts.
powers.trappings: Summoned elemental, ghostly dog, phantom servant.
additional_effects: MIND RIDER (+1): The caster can commun­icate and sense through the ally.

powers.name: Telekinesis
powers.summary: Moves items with Strength of d10 (d12 with a raise).
powers.trappings: A wave of the hand, magic wand, steely gaze.

powers.name: Teleport
powers.trappings: A cloud of smoke, “phasing” out, change into a bolt of lightning.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

TELEPORT FOE (+2): Foes may be targeted by a Touch attack (page 108). This is an action, so the casting must be the second part of a Multi-Action if the attack is successful. The foe resists the casting with an opposed Smarts roll and is sent up to 12” away with success and 24” with a raise.

powers.name: Wall Walker
powers.summary: Character can walk on walls at half Pace (full Pace with raise).
powers.trappings: Spider-like visage, prickly hairs on hands and feet.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The caster may affect others at the cost of 1 Power Point each.

powers.name: Warrior's Gift
powers.trappings: Gestures, prayer, whispered words, concentration.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL RECIPIENTS (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.

powers.name: Zombie
powers.trappings: Carving symbols on corpses, throwing bones, graveyards, “leather” books.
additional_effects: ADDITIONAL ZOMBIES (+1): A larger horde can be raised in a single casting by paying an additional 1 Power Point for each extra zombie raised.
ARMED (+1 per Zombie): The dead rise with a rusting weapon common to their setting and environment.
ARMOR (+1 per Zombie): The horrors crawl from their grave wearing 2 points of Armor. This might be old chain mail, rusting plate, rotting bulletproof vests, etc.
MIND RIDER (+1): The caster can communicate and sense through one of the undead he’s conjured. If it’s destroyed, he may jump to any of the others currently under his control.

PERMANENT (Special): The zombie is given unlife until its “death.” This has no additional cost, but the Power Points used to raise it are permanently invested and unavailable until it’s destroyed. The necromancer who raised it may terminate its unlife at any time.

powers.name: Armor
powers.trappings: A mystical glow, hardened skin, ethereal armor, a mass of insects or worms.

powers.name: Banish
powers.trappings: Holy items, arcane symbols, handful of salt.

powers.name: Barrier
powers.trappings: Fire, ice, thorns, force, bones.

powers.name: Beast Friend
powers.trappings: The mage concentrates and gestures with his hands.

powers.name: Blast
powers.trappings: Balls of fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, swarm of insects.
additional_effects: For double the Power Points, the blast does 3d6 damage, or the size is increased to a Large Burst Template. For triple the points, it does both.

powers.name: Blind
powers.trappings: Bright flash of light, sand in eyes, sticky shadows.
additional_effects: For 2 Power Points, the power affects a single target. For 4 Power Points, the power affects everyone in a Medium Burst Template. For 6 points, it affects everyone in a Large Burst Template.

powers.name: Bolt
powers.trappings: Fire, ice, light, darkness, colored bolts, insects.
additional_effects: The caster may instead cast a single 3d6 bolt for 2 Power Points. He may not cast multiple bolts when using this ability.
additional_targets: The character may cast up to 3 bolts by spending a like amount of Power Points. The bolts may be spread among targets as the character chooses. This is rolled just like fully-automatic weapons fire but without the full- auto penalty—the character rolls a spellcasting die for each bolt and compares each to the Target Number separately. If the caster is a Wild Card, he also rolls a Wild Die, which may replace any of the casting dice.
